hanzi-su-wiki:
動

Значения

Двигаться, работать

Мнемоника

  • Силой 力 сдвигать тяжесть 重.

  • Человек сдвигает тяжёлые 重 книги с силой 力.

Варианты

动

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When something is heavy, you need a lot of power to move it. It’s not going to move unless you use a lot of power. That thing is heavy and unless you use all the power you got, it’s not moving.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture a massive 1 ton weight. It’s heavy. You can’t even begin to move it without some sort of powerful machine to help you. Imagine yourself trying to move it with just your bare hands.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Remember that 1 ton weight? Well, actually it’s a doughnut (どう). A huge, massive, 1 ton doughnut. It’s super heavy and hard to move, but it’s delicious.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Okay, so you don’t have enough power to move this doughnut as is. In order to move it, you’re going to have to use your superhuman power of eating. Once you eat enough of it, the remainder will be easy to move. Imagine yourself digging into this massive doughnut and taste its fresh baked goodness on your tongue. It’s mighty tasty.
Ru_Meaning: move, motion, change, confusion, shift, shake
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 力 (сила), 日 (день), 里 (родная деревня)

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In amimes the characters have lots of muscle and can move as if flying like a rising cloud.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " strength " to " heavy " sound, the original meaning is action. "Shuowen": "Move, work, and stress. 𨔝, the ancient prose moves from Zhe." Pre-Qin classics use its original meaning, such as "Yi·XiCi": "Draft and then talk, discuss and then move ." This meaning is also used in scripts and silk texts, such as "Mawangdui. "He Yin Yang" 111: "Watch the eight movements, listen to the five tones, and observe the signs of the ten already." Tang poetry also uses its original meaning, such as Wang Wei's "Gifts from Ding Yutian's Family": "The morning chickens crowed in the neighborhood, and the group moved in accordance with their duties."

" Motion " can also be used as " doing ", which means taking action on things. For example, "Shen Zi Weide": "Ming Jun's actions must be divided by wisdom." It can also be used to change the original position and state of things, as opposed to " still ." This meaning can be seen in scripts and silk texts, such as "Mawangdui. Ten Questions" 16: "Able to move its punishment (form)", another example is "Mawangdui. Lao Zi's First Book of Old Unknown Book 47: "Should not be changed from movement to static, then things are inside (embrace) and they are outside."

The idioms that are still familiar to the public, such as "wind blowing grass moving", "moving like a rabbit", "prospering the teacher and moving the crowd" also use this meaning.

" Movement " can also be used to shake, as in the Tang poem "The Thatched House is Broken by the Autumn Wind": "There are tens of thousands of buildings in Ande, the world is full of joy, and the wind and rain are still as peaceful as a mountain"; it is used to move, as in "Lu Shi "Spring and Autumn · Possess": "Speaking and treating insincere, it is touching and unsatisfactory." Gao Yin Note: "Moving, feeling; divine, transforming. Insincere words cannot be transformed"; used as a motivator, such as "Historical Records·Le "Book": "Affection is in the middle, so the form is in the sound, and the sound is written as the sound."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " strength " and " heavy ", the original meaning is action.
humanum_full_description:
從「力」，「重」聲，本義為行動。《說文》：「動，作也。从力，重聲。𨔝，古文動从辵。」先秦典籍用其本義，如《易·繫辭上》：「擬之而後言，議之而後動。」簡帛文字也用此義，如《馬王堆．合陰陽》111：「觀八動，聽五音，察十已之徵」。唐詩亦用其本義，如王維〈丁寓田家有贈〉：「晨雞鳴鄰里，群動從所務。」

　　「動」亦可用作「做」，表示對事物採取行動。如《慎子·威德》：「明君動事分功必由慧。」；也可以用做對事物原來位置、狀態的改變，與「靜」相對。簡帛文字見此義，如《馬王堆．十問》16：「能動其刑（形）」，又如《馬王堆．老子乙本卷前古佚書》47：「不應動靜之化，則事宭（窘）於內而舉宭（窘）於外。」

　　迄今仍為大眾所熟悉的「風吹草動」、「動若脫兔」、「興師動眾」等成語也用此義。

　　「動」還可用作動搖，如唐詩〈茅屋為秋風所破歌〉：「安得廣廈千萬間，大庇天下寒士俱歡顏，風雨不動安如山」；用作感動，如《呂氏春秋·具備》：「說與治不誠，其動人心不神」，高誘注：「動，感；神，化。言不誠不能行其化」；用作發動，如《史記·樂書》：「情動於中，故形於聲，聲成文謂之音」。

(Simplified: 动)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 靜 止
Pictophonetic: 重 (strength) indicates the sound; 力 conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 重 [ zhòng ] heavy, weighty; to double, to repeat
    • 力 [ lì ] strength, power; capability, influence
①改變原來位置或脫離靜止狀態，與“靜”相對：變動。波動。浮動。振動(物體通過一箇中心位置，不斷作往復運動。亦稱“振盪”)。震動(a。顫動或使顫動，如“門窗動動了一下”；b。重大事情或消息使人心不平靜，如“動動全國”)。
②使開始發生：發動。
③使用：動用。動武。動問(客套話，請問)。
④使起作用或變化，使感情起變化：感動。動人心絃。娓娓動聽。動容。
⑤喫(多用於否定式)：這幾天不動葷腥。
⑥非靜止的：動畫。
⑦可變的：動產。
⑧行爲：舉動。動作。
⑨常常：動輒得咎。

從「 力 」，「 重 」聲，本義為行動。《說文》：「動，作也。从力，重聲。𨔝，古文動从辵。」先秦典籍用其本義，如《易·繫辭上》：「擬之而後言，議之而後動。」簡帛文字也用此義，如《馬王堆．合陰陽》111：「觀八動，聽五音，察十已之徵」。唐詩亦用其本義，如王維〈丁寓田家有贈〉：「晨雞鳴鄰里，群動從所務。」 「 動 」亦可用作「 做 」，表示對事物採取行動。如《慎子·威德》：「明君動事分功必由慧。」；也可以用做對事物原來位置、狀態的改變，與「 靜 」相對。簡帛文字見此義，如《馬王堆．十問》16：「能動其刑（形）」，又如《馬王堆．老子乙本卷前古佚書》47：「不應動靜之化，則事宭（窘）於內而舉宭（窘）於外。」 迄今仍為大眾所熟悉的「風吹草動」、「動若脫兔」、「興師動眾」等成語也用此義。 「 動 」還可用作動搖，如唐詩〈茅屋為秋風所破歌〉：「安得廣廈千萬間，大庇天下寒士俱歡顏，風雨不動安如山」；用作感動，如《呂氏春秋·具備》：「說與治不誠，其動人心不神」，高誘注：「動，感；神，化。言不誠不能行其化」；用作發動，如《史記·樂書》：「情動於中，故形於聲，聲成文謂之音」。
From " strength" to " heavy" sound, the original meaning is action. "Shuowen": "Move, work, and stress. 𨔝, the ancient prose moves from Zhe." Pre-Qin classics use its original meaning, such as "Yi·XiCi": "Draft and then talk, discuss and then move ." This meaning is also used in scripts and silk texts, such as "Mawangdui. "He Yin Yang" 111: "Watch the eight movements, listen to the five tones, and observe the signs of the ten already." Tang poetry also uses its original meaning, such as Wang Wei's "Gifts from Ding Yutian's Family": "The morning chickens crowed in the neighborhood, and the group moved in accordance with their duties." " Motion" can also be used as " doing", which means taking action on things. For example, "Shen Zi Weide": "Ming Jun's actions must be divided by wisdom." It can also be used to change the original position and state of things, as opposed to " still." This meaning can be seen in scripts and silk texts, such as "Mawangdui. Ten Questions" 16: "Able to move its punishment (form)", another example is "Mawangdui. Lao Zi's First Book of Old Unknown Book 47: "Should not be changed from movement to static, then things are inside (embrace) and they are outside." The idioms that are still familiar to the public, such as "wind blowing grass moving", "moving like a rabbit", "prospering the teacher and moving the crowd" also use this meaning. " Movement" can also be used to shake, as in the Tang poem "The Thatched House is Broken by the Autumn Wind": "There are tens of thousands of buildings in Ande, the world is full of joy, and the wind and rain are still as peaceful as a mountain"; it is used to move, as in "Lu Shi "Spring and Autumn · Possess": "Speaking and treating insincere, it is touching and unsatisfactory." Gao Yin Note: "Moving, feeling; divine, transforming. Insincere words cannot be transformed"; used as a motivator, such as "Historical Records·Le "Book": "Affection is in the middle, so the form is in the sound, and the sound is written as the sound."

動字的基本解释

動
dòng
见“动”。

動字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dòng］
［《廣韻》徒揔切，上董，定。］
亦作“勭2”。“动1”的繁体字。
(1)脱离静止状态。振动；活动；移动。
(2)行动；采取行动。
(3)劳作；操作。
(4)发，发作。
(5)萌生；萌动。
(6)变化。
(7)谓思想受影响而动摇、改变。
(8)感动；触动。
(9)引动，招致。
(10)使用；动用。
(11)往往；常常。
(12)不觉。
(13)指动物。
(14)方言。吃。多用于否定式。
(15)通“穜”。耕种。
(16)通“慟”。

move
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dòng］
["Guangyun" only cut and cut, go to Dong, set. ]
Also known as "勭2". Traditional characters for "动1".
(1) Get out of the static state. Vibration; activity; movement.
(2) Action; take action.
(3) Work; operation.
(4) Fat and seizures.
(5) Sprouting; sprouting.
(6) Change.
(7) It is said that thoughts are affected and shaken and changed.
(8) Moved; touched.
(9) Motivated, incurred.
(10) Use; use.
(11) Often; often.
(12) Not aware of it.
(13) Refers to animals.
(14) Dialects. eat. Mostly used for negative expressions.
(15) Through "穜". Farming.
(16) Through "恸".
move

dòng
вм. 动

動

Значения

Двигаться, работать

Мнемоника

  • Силой 力 сдвигать тяжесть 重.

  • Человек сдвигает тяжёлые 重 книги с силой 力.

Варианты

动

Radicals: 重, 力  (heavy, power)
Meaning Mnemonic
When something is heavy, you need a lot of power to move it. It’s not going to move unless you use a lot of power. That thing is heavy and unless you use all the power you got, it’s not moving.
Picture a massive 1 ton weight. It’s heavy. You can’t even begin to move it without some sort of powerful machine to help you. Imagine yourself trying to move it with just your bare hands.
Reading Mnemonic
Remember that 1 ton weight? Well, actually it’s a doughnut (どう). A huge, massive, 1 ton doughnut. It’s super heavy and hard to move, but it’s delicious.
Okay, so you don’t have enough power to move this doughnut as is. In order to move it, you’re going to have to use your superhuman power of eating. Once you eat enough of it, the remainder will be easy to move. Imagine yourself digging into this massive doughnut and taste its fresh baked goodness on your tongue. It’s mighty tasty.
